newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenia's Radenska slumps, more losses feared.
newsitem.headline: Slovenia's Radenska slumps, more losses feared.

text.p: Shares of Slovenian mineral water producer and health resort operator Radenska dropped 9.08 percent to 1,673 tolars on Monday as a raft of small investors bailed out of the stock.

"The reason for the fall is the fact that many small investors, who bought Radenska's shares in the voucher privatisation process, got tired of waiting for a better price," said Jernej Zizek, a trader at "A" banka.

Market participants said Radenska could fall to 1,500 tolars in the next few days if small investors continued to sell on the back of limp 1996 results and an apparent reluctance by Radenska to defend its share price.
"Radenska is not agressive enough. They could appoint a market maker to defend the price of their shares but they are not active at all," said one trader.
Radenska earlier this month reported a 7.4 percent drop in preliminary 1996 net profit to 547 million tolars due to a colder summer that caused a fall in sales of soft drinks.
